formattedAddress: 371 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 371 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of attending the NYC Pizza School with my coworkers, and I must say, it was a great experience.

The class strikes a perfect balance between fun and education. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I learned about the art of crafting the perfect pizza. And the best part? The pizzas we made were incredibly tasty!

I recommend arriving with an empty stomach because, before diving into the pizza-making process, your team will be treated to some pre-made pizzas with delightful and unexpected toppings. Additionally, the school offers a wide selection of drinks to complement your pizza creations. All in all, I recommend this experience to everyone who wants to learn to make the classic NYC pizza.

originalText.text: I joined NYC Pizza School for a virtual class recently and loved it.  The class was thorough, very lively, and perfectly paced so that each attendee was able to showcase their pizza and enjoy a slice!  All questions were answered in the class and the email follow up to additional questions has been great. Highly recommended and a great value!

originalText.text: Such a fantastic event and the group had a wonderful time. Mark, Claudio and Eduardo were all amazing. We are all looking forward to putting our new pizza making skills to use! Highly recommend Pizza School for anyone thinking about a team building event or just the having a great time with friends. You won’t be disappointed!

text.text: Such a fantastic event and the group had a wonderful time. Mark, Claudio and Eduardo were all amazing. We are all looking forward to putting our new pizza making skills to use! Highly recommend Pizza School for anyone thinking about a team building event or just the having a great time with friends. You won’t be disappointed!

originalText.text: I planned a company holiday party at the Pizza School NYC and it was the best decision I ever made! As most companies, we have had a tough year and this was the perfect way to end the year and cheers to 2024. We had such a great time eating some delicious pizza, learning how to make the best pizza and drinking the night away. Mark was absolutely amazing and got to know all of us in such a short time. It felt like we were part of the family as soon as we walked in. Jenny was absolutely amazing helping with all of the planning and keeping me at ease. It was the easiest planning on my end and it was worth every penny. I highly recommend to smaller companies or teams for a team building experience without the forced team building feeling. We came out of the event energized (plus insanely full) and ready to conquer another year. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: This was a fantastic group activity. We started off with a selection of wine and a sampling of pizzas that showed the range of possibilities. Mark led us through the making of the dough from getting the yeast started to kneading the initial ball. While the dough was rising he walked us through a mozzarella tasting and a variety of tips for the pizzas we were about to create. Then it was off the races with your own creations. Mark was engaging and handled our unruly crowd with ease. Eduardo and Ricky were a great help as we prepared our pies. If you love pizza, you will learn something, make better pizza at how, appreciate good pizzerias, and have a wonderful evening doing it. Great music playlist and dance break complete with disco ball. It was a lot of fun but make no mistake this is a serious pizza technique experience. Highly recommend for a family (we had 18 family and friends), a group friends, or a work group.
